Meditation

I practise Vipassana meditation as taught by S. N. Goenka in the tradition of Sayagyi U Ba Khin. I try to join at least one 10-day retreat every year apart from maintaining a daily practise of 2 hours. The technique of meditation employed here is quite pragmatic: focussing on one's own respiration to calm down the mind and then observing the various different sensations on the body equanimously to purify the mind. Of course, it takes time and dedication. I have found that over the years Vipassana has helped me improve myself in all walks of life. I can't recommend this enough if you are looking for a complete reboot and to get to know a deeper part of yourself. The courses are conducted in a 10-day residential format and are offered free of cost in over 200 centers around the world. All the costs in this wonderful tradition are covered by donations coming from grateful old students.

Literature

I am quite fond of Hindi poetry, especially from the Chhayawaad period between 1922-1938. The poetic style of this period makes heavy use of Sanskrit vocabulary and uses strict rules of meter/rhyme. My favorite Poetess is Mahadevi Verma , one of the 4 pillars of Chhayawaad. A melodius recitation of her work titled "Jo tum aa jate ek baar" that she wrote for Tathagata, the Buddha, can be found here . My favorite poetic composition is the epic of Kamayani by Jaishankar Prasad , another one of the 4 pillars of Chhayawaad. A beautiful rendition of another epic poem from this era called Madhushala , composed by Harivansh Rai Bachhan was achieved by the famous vocalist Manna Dey.
